# This workflow is designed to deploy a Next.js (or any npm-based) project
# to Firebase Hosting using a remote Linux environment, completely bypassing
# local Windows file system errors.

name: Deploy to Firebase Hosting

on:
  push:
    branches:
      - master # Triggers on push to the 'master' branch

jobs:
  build_and_deploy:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest # Runs on a clean Linux environment

    steps:
      - name: Checkout code
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      # 1. Setup Node.js Environment
      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: '20' # Use a modern version

      # 2. Install Dependencies (Crucial step that runs fine on Linux)
      - name: Install Dependencies
        run: npm install

      # 3. Run Next.js Build (Creates the .next directory)
      - name: Build Project
        run: npm run build

      # 4. Deploy to Firebase (Uses the Firebase token)
      - name: Deploy to Firebase
        uses: FirebaseExtended/action-hosting-deploy@v0
        with:
          repoToken: '${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}'
          firebaseServiceAccount: ${{ secrets.FIREBASE_SERVICE_ACCOUNT_STUDIO_858636471_DC582 }}
          channelId: live
          projectId: studio-858636471-dc582
          # We instruct Firebase to use the Next.js build output
          entryPoint: .
